channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey have been subpoenaed by the DOJ
item.description: The Minnesota attorney general and St. Paul mayor have also been subpoenaed as local, state and federal officials have clashed in the aftermath of the shooting of Renee Good by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded:
The Minnesota attorney general and St. Paul mayor have also been subpoenaed as local, state and federal officials have clashed in the aftermath of the shooting of Renee Good by an ICE agent.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: ASEAN won't endorse election in military-ruled Myanmar, Malaysia says
item.description: Malaysia's foreign minister Mohamad Hasan cited concerns over the lack of inclusive and free participation.
item.content:encoded:
Malaysia's foreign minister Mohamad Hasan cited concerns over the lack of inclusive and free participation.

(Image credit: Rafiq Maqbool)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'The miracle': A 6-year-old walked away from the train wreck that killed her family
item.description: Her parents, brother and cousin were killed in the collision, but the girl was found walking barefoot on the tracks. She's being cared for by grandparents after receiving three stitches in her head.
item.content:encoded:
Her parents, brother and cousin were killed in the collision, but the girl was found walking barefoot on the tracks. She's being cared for by grandparents after receiving three stitches in her head.

(Image credit: Manu Fernandez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says U.K. return of Chagos Islands to Mauritius is reason to acquire Greenland
item.description: The president previously supported Britain's agreement to hand back sovereignty of the Indian Ocean archipelago, where the U.K. continues to lease the U.S.-U.K. Diego Garcia military base.
item.content:encoded:
The president previously supported Britain's agreement to hand back sovereignty of the Indian Ocean archipelago, where the U.K. continues to lease the U.S.-U.K. Diego Garcia military base.

(Image credit: U.S. Navy)
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: Poet Rachel Eliza Griffiths says she won't let pain be 'the engine that drives the ship'
item.description: On the day Griffiths married author Salman Rushdie, her longtime best friend died unexpectedly. Eleven months later, Rushdie was stabbed multiple times while being interviewed on stage.
item.content:encoded:
On the day Griffiths married author Salman Rushdie, her longtime best friend died unexpectedly. Eleven months later, Rushdie was stabbed multiple times while being interviewed on stage.

(Image credit: Andres Kudacki)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Here's who's canceled their Kennedy Center performances since Trump took over
item.description: The Martha Graham Dance Company is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.
item.content:encoded:
The Martha Graham Dance Company is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: The divorce between the U.S. and WHO is final this week. Or is it?
item.description: The U.S. is the only country allowed to withdraw from the World Health Organization. And Jan. 22 is the day when Trump's pullout announcement should go into effect. But ... it's complicated.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. is the only country allowed to withdraw from the World Health Organization. And Jan. 22 is the day when Trump's pullout announcement should go into effect. But ... it's complicated.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Trump's Board of Peace has several invited leaders trying to figure out how it'll work
item.description: It's unclear how many leaders have been asked to join the board, and the large number of invitations being sent out, including to countries that don't get along, has raised questions about the board's mandate and decision-making processes.
item.content:encoded:
It's unclear how many leaders have been asked to join the board, and the large number of invitations being sent out, including to countries that don't get along, has raised questions about the board's mandate and decision-making processes.

(Image credit: Mahmoud Illean)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Researchers find Antarctic penguin breeding is heating up sooner
item.description: Warming temperatures are forcing Antarctic penguins to breed earlier and that's a big problem for two of the cute tuxedoed species that face extinction by the end of the century, a study said.
item.content:encoded:
Warming temperatures are forcing Antarctic penguins to breed earlier and that's a big problem for two of the cute tuxedoed species that face extinction by the end of the century, a study said.

(Image credit: Mark Baker)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As Trump dismantles the existing world order, his version is still taking shape
item.description: In his second term, the president is embracing a foreign policy that breaks sharply from U.S. tradition. Both supporters and critics say he's upending a global system in place for 80 years.
item.content:encoded:
In his second term, the president is embracing a foreign policy that breaks sharply from U.S. tradition. Both supporters and critics say he's upending a global system in place for 80 years.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
